content: लंघनं [लंघ्-ल्युट्] {@--1@} Leaping, jumping. {@--2@} Going by leaps, traversing, passing over, going, motion in general; यूयमेव पथि शीघ्रलंघनाः <ls>Ghaṭ. 8.</ls> {@--3@} Mounting, ascending, rising up to (<ab>fig.</ab> also); नभोलंघन <ls>R. 16. 33</ls>; जनोयमुच्चैःपदलंघनोत्सुकः <ls>Ku. 5. 64</ls> ‘wishing to attain or aspire to a high position.’ {@--4@} Assaulting, storming, capturing; as in दुर्गलंघनं. {@--5@} Exceeding, going beyond, overstepping violating, transgression; आज्ञालंघनं, नियमलंघनं &c. {@--6@} Disregarding, despising, treating with contempt, slighting; प्रणिपातलंघनं प्रमार्ष्टुकामा <ls>V. 3</ls>; <ls>M. 3. 22.</ls> {@--7@} An offence, affront, insult. {@--8@} A harm, an injury; as in आतपलंघनं <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--9@} Fasting, abstinence; <ls>Śi. 12. 25</ls> (where it means ‘leaping’ also). {@--10@} One of the paces of a horse.
